FuncDef:
The remote-attestation ssl crl load command loads an SSL certificate revocation list (CRL) onto a device.
The undo remote-attestation ssl crl load command removes an SSL CRL from a device.
By default, no SSL CRL is loaded.
CLIs: undo remote-attestation ssl crl load pem-crl <crlFile>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a CRL file that is in the PEM format.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks (").
The name of this file must be the same as that of the file to be uploaded.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The lifetime of a digital certificate is limited, and a CA can revoke the digital certificate to shorten the certificate lifetime. A CRL specifies a list of invalid certificates issued by CAs. If a CA revokes a certificate, the declaration about authorized key pairs is revoked before the certificate expires. Once the CRL expires, data listed in the CRL is deleted to shorten the CRL.
A certificate needs to be revoked due to various reasons, for example, key disclosure. In this case, a third-party tool can be used to mark the issued certificate invalid. Such certificates are listed in a CRL. To load an SSL CRL onto a device, run the remote-attestation ssl crl load command.
